Message:
I’m a mail carrier.
My job is to deliver letters.
So, I made my way
to the church.

“You’re that mail carrier
from before, aren’t you?”

He was one of the men
who took everything from me.
But, I’m not scared anymore.

For the first time,
I looked directly at his face,
only to realize
how ordinary it was.

He wasn’t a terrifying demon
or a cruel monster.
Just an ordinary man.

The confused look on his face
as he stared at the letters,
each with no address, was just
one of the many expressions
I’d seen on other recipients.

“Mom, Dad.
I’m still doing my best
to make it on my own.

From now on, I’m going to
live my life to the fullest...
For the both of you.”

I’m sure the man
won’t understand
the meaning of the letters...
and that’s fine.

I no longer felt the need
for revenge or forgiveness.

As I left the church,
something wet
ran down my cheek.
The time that had
stood still for me
began to move once more.
